content.question: An isolated satellite with rotational inertia <math alttext="uppercase l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> is initially spinning with constant angular velocity <math alttext="omega sub lowercase i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> when it suddenly extends several antennae, causing its rotational inertia to increase to <math alttext="3 uppercase l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>I</mi></math>. After the antennae are extended, the satellite has angular speed <math alttext="omega sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly relates <math alttext="omega sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> to <math alttext="omega sub lowercase i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="omega sub f equals 3 omega sub lowercase i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="omega sub f equals omega sub lowercase i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="omega sub f equals, the fraction omega sub lowercase i over the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="omega sub f equals, the fraction omega sub lowercase i over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="omega sub f equals, the fraction omega sub lowercase i over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>i</mi></msub><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
